title: Instant Pot Turkey Breast Recipe
description: This Instant Pot turkey breast is a no-fuss recipe for an easy main dish of moist meat with a side of thick gravy that cooks in just about an hour.
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Meat and Poultry Turkey Turkey Breast Instant Pot Turkey Breast 4.6 (88) 77 Reviews 11 Photos This Instant Pot turkey breast is the moistest I have ever made. I usually cook this in the slow cooker all day, but it turns out so much better in the Instant Pot. I couldn't believe that I had such a wonderful meal ready in less than an hour! Submitted by Tammy Lynn Updated on April 25, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 11 11 11 11 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 35 mins Additional Time: 20 mins Total Time: 1 hr 5 mins Servings: 8 Yield: 6 pounds Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (1 ounce) package onion soup mix 1 (6 pound) turkey breast, thawed 2 ribs celery, cut into large chunks 1 onion, cut into large chunks 1 cup chicken broth 2 tablespoons water 1 tablespoon cornstarch, or more as needed Directions Sprinkle onion soup mix all over turkey breast and place in the pot of an electric pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Arrange celery and onion over and around turkey. Pour chicken broth over turkey. Seal and lock the lid. Select high/low pressure on the Poultry setting or according to manufacturer's instructions; cook until juices run clear, about 30 minutes. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes. Transfer turkey to a plate and slice; cover to keep warm. Switch to the Sauté setting. Mix together water and cornstarch in a small bowl; stir in a small amount of hot liquid from the pot until combined. Pour back into the pot and whisk until gravy is well thickened, about 3 minutes. Serve gravy alongside sliced turkey. I Made It Print 226 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 584 Calories 22g Fat 5g Carbs 86g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 584 % Daily Value * Total Fat 22g 28% Saturated Fat 6g 31% Cholesterol 220mg 73% Sodium 655mg 28% Total Carbohydrate 5g 2% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 1g Protein 86g 171% Vitamin C 2mg 2% Calcium 79mg 6% Iron 4mg 24% Potassium 915mg 19% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Instant Pot Turkey Breast 01 of 11 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 11 Photo by  Murff 12/05/2019 I made this recipe as it was described and it was great. I also sprinkled on some poultry seasoning as suggested. The simplest way is sometimes the best. I'll be making this a lot for the holidays. 03 of 11 Photo by  zashin 12/05/2019 Made it as is and it was really good. Will make it again for sure. 04 of 11 Photo by  zashin 12/05/2019 Made it as is and it was really good. Will make it again for sure. 05 of 11 Photo by  Deb C 11/28/2019 I wasn't a fan of the gravy, but the turkey came out perfectly. It was moist and juicy. My Instant Pot didn't have a poultry button so I used the pressure cooker button. I will always cook the turkey breast in the Instant Pot from now on. 06 of 11 Photo by  Bren 06/11/2019 Hmmm, not sure why my review isn't showing. I had a small, 2 pound, turkey breast that was partially frozen so I cooked it for 20 minutes, I wasn't sure what the submitter meant by "Poultry" hight/low setting so I used manual pressure. The turkey was incredibly tender and moist, even the family member that doesn't usually like white meat loved it! I did find the gravy very salty, probably the turkey breast and not the recipe! This will be a repeat at our home, easy, moist and tender. Thanks for sharing Tammy Lynn. 07 of 11 Photo by  Yoly 02/14/2019 This was very easy to make and it turned out great! Moist and tender in just a few minutes. 08 of 11 Photo by  Isobel Walls 01/12/2019 What a great recipe! I set the time on the instant pot to 40 minutes & did a natural release for 10 minutes. I did not use poultry button —I hit pressure cook button insead! When I thickened the gravy I scooped out the celery & then turned on the saute button to thicken gravy! Served boiled potatoes & steamed broccol!!This is a keeper! 09 of 11 Photo by  Joyce 11/22/2018 I made it exactly as directed. Delicious and moist; and, it's plenty of turkey for my small Thanksgiving table. Easiest, fastest Thanksgiving ever! 10 of 11 Photo by  MaryEllen 10/20/2018 1 2 Next You’ll Also Love Instant Pot Frozen Turkey Breast 23 Ratings Boneless Turkey Breast in the Instant Pot® 9 Ratings Bacon-Wrapped Turkey Breast Stuffed with Spinach and Feta 19 Ratings Slow Cooker Herbed Turkey Breast 52 Ratings Roasted Turkey Breast With Herbs 22 Ratings Turkey a la Oscar 26 Ratings Air Fryer Turkey Breast 7 Ratings Olive-Brined Air Fryer Turkey Breast 4 Ratings Turkey Divan 32 Ratings Slow Cooker Turkey Breast 1,655 Ratings Slow Cooker Boneless Turkey Breast 191 Ratings Instant Pot Turkey Bone Broth Instant Pot Turkey Stock Grilled Chile-Lime Turkey Breast Instant Pot Keto Chicken Thighs in Lemon-Garlic Cream Sauce 20 Ratings Instant Pot Greek Chicken 22 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Tammy Lynn
instructions: Sprinkle onion soup mix all over turkey breast and place in the pot of an electric pressure cooker (such as Instant Pot). Arrange celery and onion over and around turkey. Pour chicken broth over turkey.;Seal and lock the lid. Select high/low pressure on the Poultry setting or according to manufacturer's instructions; cook until juices run clear, about 30 minutes. Release pressure using the natural-release method according to manufacturer's instructions, about 20 minutes. Transfer turkey to a plate and slice; cover to keep warm.;Switch to the Sauté setting. Mix together water and cornstarch in a small bowl; stir in a small amount of hot liquid from the pot until combined. Pour back into the pot and whisk until gravy is well thickened, about 3 minutes. Serve gravy alongside sliced turkey.
